definition.en: Uneven skin texture refers to rough, bumpy, or irregular skin surface. It can manifest as roughness, bumps, flakiness, or raised areas caused by dead skin cells, acne scars, sun damage, or loss of collagen.

causes: Loss of collagen and elastin with age
prevention: Use retinoids to boost cell turnover
Avoid picking at skin or acne
Treat acne promptly to prevent scarring

mild.description: Slight roughness, minor dry patches, subtle texture issues

moderate.description: Noticeable roughness, visible texture, some scarring or bumps

severe.description: Deep scarring, significant roughness, orange-peel texture, pitted scars

whenToSeeDermatologist: Texture doesn't improve with home treatments after 3 months
Keratosis pilaris not responding to treatment

statistics.acneScars: 80% of people aged 11-30 have acne, many develop scars
statistics.improvement: Texture improvement takes 8-12 weeks with consistent treatment
statistics.collagen: Skin loses 1% of collagen per year after age 30

types.icePickScars: Deep, narrow, pitted scars from severe acne
types.boxcarScars: Broad, box-like depressions with defined edges
types.rollingScars: Wide, shallow scars with sloping edges
types.keratosisPilaris: Small, rough bumps (chicken skin) on arms, thighs, buttocks, face

myths.myth: Physical scrubs are the best way to smooth texture
myths.fact: Chemical exfoliants (AHAs, BHAs) are more effective and gentler. Physical scrubs can cause micro-tears and worsen texture.

myths.myth: Acne scars will fade on their own
myths.fact: Deep atrophic scars (ice pick, boxcar, rolling) are permanent without treatment. Only PIH (dark spots) fades naturally.

myths.myth: You can't fix texture without lasers
myths.fact: Retinoids, chemical peels, and microneedling can significantly improve texture. Lasers are one option but not the only one.
Dehydrated skin can appear rough. Proper moisturization plumps skin and improves texture appearance.

evening: Facial oil (squalane, rosehip) for extra hydration
weekly: Enzyme mask or chemical exfoliating mask

chemical.ahas: Water-soluble, work on surface. Best for: dry skin, sun damage, fine lines
chemical.bhas: Oil-soluble, penetrate pores. Best for: oily skin, acne, blackheads
chemical.enzymes: Gentle, digest dead cells. Best for: sensitive skin, mild texture

physical.gentle: Konjac sponge, soft washcloth, jojoba beads
physical.avoid: Walnut shells, apricot kernels, harsh scrubs (cause micro-tears)

microneedling.bestFor: Acne scars, fine lines, overall texture
